intro: Hancea longistyla, commonly known as the long-styled hancea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with prominent stamens and a long style, which is a distinguishing feature. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
